An awesome game! When I first started playing Hexcells, I quickly saw a similar playstyle to the classic Minesweeper. This game, however, takes this playstyle to a whole new level. Very simple rules and relaxed, minimal gameplay, but the puzzle design consistently challenges your ability to analyze and think critically. There are six worlds in the game, and each one adds a new twist into the ruleset, ensuring that the challenge is constantly adapted as you master previous puzzle sets. The only complaint I can think of is that the ambient music can get quite annoying due to its repetition and lack of rhythm.

Overall, I would recommend this game to all puzzle-gamers, as it provides a relaxed but interesting mental challenge.

39129698.review:
Действительно отличная головоломка!

Hexcell - это, по сути, гексагональный сапер, с элементами нонограмм. Игра сопровождается приятной расслабляющей музыкой, а визуальное оформление радует глаз. Сложность пазлов увеличивается от уровня к уровню, при этом введение новых элементов игры сопровождается легкими обучающими уровнями. Все это позволяет игроку легко погрузиться в игровой процесс. 

С удовольствием прошел запоем игру от начала до конца.  Единственное, из-за чего пришлось пару раз начинать уровни заново – кнопки мышки. Они тут по сравнению с классическим сапером совсем наоборот :-) Где-то в подсознании видимо все же сидит мысль, что играешь-то все же в сапер, пусть и новый, улучшенный, красивый. Возможно, впечатление от первых уровней. Так или иначе, задумавшись, все же иногда нажимаешь кнопки по старинке.

The best games are those that are simple, and hex cells manages this while still presenting plenty of challenge. The format is similar to the classic Minesweeper, but no guessing is required and as you advance additional markings come into play as well as the simple 'this many surrounding cells'. I did have to search online to clarify the rules at one point as it was unclear whether the '-x-' marking meant they cannot touch each other at all or simply that they aren't all in a block, and I was easily able to find clarification on the forums (it's the latter). It is a short game, I consider myself very good at these sorts of puzzles and although steam says I took 1.8 hours I know some of that was time I left the game open while doing other things, I'd estimate the actual time to be 1.5 hours at most, but I think the average player would get more out of this game.
The only flaw is that there are no procedurally generated puzzles however this is included in one of the sequels and at the low price of the game that seems fair. The interface is simplistic in a very good way and the game feels very well polished for the low price. Time to start the second level pack! (Hexcells Plus)

38800708.review:
Hexcells is the first entry of a trio of puzzle games by Matthew Brown, a game all about using logic and nothing else to solve a collection of puzzles. I'm not always one for puzzle games but did I enjoy this one? This is what I think of Hexcells.

Yes. Yes, I enjoyed playing this game very much. For such a simple concept it really is engaging, and playing this set of puzzles through after so long playing the random puzzles on Hexcells Infinite showcased exactly how much better and faster I've gotten at solving these than when I last played some years ago. I don't play a lot of puzzle style games but this series is definitely a favourite of mine. It's just so relaxing. 

The whole point of the game is running through a series of levels that increasingly get harder as you go on. The objective is simple; colour in certain hexes and delete others in a Minesweeper-esque fashion but without the guesswork...most of the time. Fans will lecture you that logic is all that is required but even now I occasionally had to take a leap of faith on a couple harder levels. I guess I just suck. I'm ok with that. 

As you move through the game it throws more rules at you as the puzzles get bigger. You start with hexes with a number in them that indicate how many hexes surround it. That turns into outside numbers noting the number in a certain column, as well as numbers in brackets indicating hexes are chained together or are separate in the same row or around a certain hex. It is great progression, and with such wonderful hand-crafted levels, it is a joy to play through. 

It's a short game though. It could have done with more levels, and you can say this of any of this series, apart from Hexcells Infinite with its random generator providing endless levels. I think it's intended to be a short and sweet type of experience but I thought it worth mentioning. Also, as I said, a couple of times I had to guess but that might just mean I'm not smart enough. Take that as you will.

Overall, this is the start of a great series. I wasn't overly smitten with SquareCells and have yet to try CrossCells and I was eager to try Hexcells again after finding I preferred this style to SquareCells. It certainly didn't disappoint. Although short, It was a great time even if you are used to Infinite's random levels. Well worth a purchase simply to run through the excellent levels. Get the whole series in the Logic Puzzle Pack bundle, should be pretty cheap and if you are in to a chilled, relaxing experience this is the series for you.

38565857.review:
[h1] ヘクスを使った手軽なロジックパズル [/h1]

ヒントに従って、左クリックでヘクスをぽちぽちと塗りつぶしていくパズル。
マインスイーパーや数独、イラストロジックの良いところを取り入れたようなプレイ感で、実に面白い。

ちなみに数字の書かれているヘクスは、その周囲で塗りつぶす必要があるヘクス数を示している。塗りつぶしてはいけないヘクスの上で右クリックすると、新たなヒントヘクスが表示されるというルールだ。

すべてのヘクスを明らかにすれば面クリアとなり、ミスした回数を減算した分のスコアが加算される。
（おそらくは）ランダム要素がなく、じっくり考えればノーミスで解ける仕組みになっていると思われるが、なかなかに難しい。

ボリュームの少なさが、唯一残念なところか。

38552642.review:
Though it's driven by logic, what I want to highlight is just how dreamily relaxing and casual this game can be.  You think, point, and click (left/right), and that's all.  I play to unwind at the end of the day; on a big TV, it's easily played lying on the couch (at a proper angle), and you may eventually be lulled to sleep.  The only downside to this approach is that the white screens are bright and need to be muted with a color-temperature app; SquareCells, one of the follow-ups, is not quite so good on the puzzle side but has the considerable advantage of a dark mode.

OK, in a bit more detail.  As you must know, this game is a series of well-crafted puzzles in a simple ruleset inspired by Minesweeper, where you get more information as you make correct deductions.  Much like Sudoku, it is an inherently incremental sort of puzzle game where you fill in the blanks by a series of inferences based on a few simple insights.  The challenge is in patiently looking around the board for the next opportunity.

On the one hand, I regard this type of puzzle as 'busywork'.  It doesn't really ask for creative insights or unusual maneuvers like some of my favorite puzzlers (Stephen's Sausage Roll, Snakebird, Cosmic Express).  On the other hand, it is satisfying and relaxing, and there is real artistry in the designs here and in the two sequels (which grow a bit more challenging).

Sublime puzzler. Simply concepts but ramps up nicely in difficulty. 37961235.review:
Oh I loved this game. The only bad thing I can say is that it's maybe too short to my linking. Took me about 2 hours to finish all levels on perfect. If you're buying this game please do as others say and grab the complete pack (which includes infinite). You won't regret it, trust me.

The game itself is kind of a crossover between minesweeper and picross (from a logical perspective, naturally). If you've played any or both of them, you'll quickly find yourself using the learned skills and mindset you already got when playing them. The complexity though, doesn't come from the fact that the mechanics of either are difficult by themselves, but rather from their wonderful combination. Though I must admit that from the minesweeper perspective, a hexagonal grid makes things a little too simple, considering that each cell can only have 6 neighbors (instead of 8) and that the board isn't filled evenly (sometimes neigbor cells are void). But again, it's the added twists that hit the sweetspot on the difficulty level.

If you're a hardcore minesweeper player, do yourself a favor: Before launching the game go to the other tab and swap the mouse buttons. Also, marking cells that shouldn't be marked counts as a mistake, so avoid marking compulsively. Your long earned habits can sometimes get in the way (as it happened to me). Thank me later.

PD: If somebody else says that minesweeper is random, take that comment with a grain of salt. Minesweeper IS deterministic at its core. It's the game imlpementations that create puzzles where hints are not enough to completely determine the locations of mines, leading you to the situation where you have to guess and risk losing the round. If only implementations were a bit more wiser than simply dropping mines at random and then filling the surrounding squares with hints...

English (deutsche Version unten):
I got this as part of a logic puzzle pack and was pleasently surprised - given the small prize this really is a lovely game for people who love puzzling. As pointed out by others repeatedly the basic game mechanics remind a bit of minesweeper, but while I did play a healthy share of minesweeper back in the day, I never liked the random guessing that was an integral part there - and that's why I really like Hexcells which is pure straightforward logic with no guessing at all. The perfect relaxation when you need a short break of work.

Deutsch

Bedenkt man den geringen und überaus fairen Preis bekommt man ein unterhaltsames und nicht besonders schweres Spiel, immer vorausgesetzt man mag Logikpuzzles. Wie mehrfach in anderen Reviews erwähnt erinnert das Spiel auf den ersten Blick ein wenig an Minesweeper, allerdings ohne das dort oft notwendige wilde Herumraten - für mich persönlich ein deutlicher Pluspunkt füpr Hexcells. 37486276.review:
Hexcells is a rarity of a puzzle game: A perfectly logical game with relatively simple rules that manages to explore the space of its idea without getting stale. The first puzzles in the game are easy; by the end, there's some decidedly non-trivial reasoning going into every click. But every move can be made perfectly logically - not a single guess is required, no matter how maddeningly it may feel like a puzzle has no information left to share.

It and its two sequels are the games I judge other logic-puzzle games by. Some live up, many don't, but I haven't found one that surpasses it yet.

Very much minesweeper-like in that your goal is to figure out the status of blocks through the information in adjacent blocks, but with some design tweaks that makes the game experience highly rewarding, satisfying and nothing like the suffering that is minesweeper. Try it out to see just how much better you can make that game with some effort. Or how level design can massively impact how a map plays with the same mechanics. Or how a great audioscape promotes flow of play. Or how to make a great learning curve over a set of maps.

36591239.review:
You'll figure out in the first five minutes if you like this game. It's a good quick puzzle game that feels like if minesweeper was more tightly designed and got a soundtrack. 

I like how simple the ruleset is. It's almost too simple; something about this game doesn't feel right to play on a pc where i'd normally be playing League of legends and stuff, but the simplicity of the game makes it very clear that 90% of the time you mess up it's all your fault and not you just making 50/50 coinflips (It does happen occasionally in this game though, especially during the later levels when more rules are introduced). There also a real reason to perfect every level, you can get through the game only making a few mistakes every now and again. Despite this simplicity each level does enough diferent to be interesting and the game is short enough where i don't expect to really lost interest. It's also really easy to pick up and show a younger sibling (if you need to get them off your back). Its a very easy pick up and play game, would recommend for a chill afternoon.

The only thing i would want is a reset level button/pause menu, instead of just having to go to the main menu. Also when you have these really large puzzles, maybe a zoom in feature would be nice.

36442246.review:
扫雷可谓是经典，人人都玩过。
但，六边形的扫雷呢？这就有点意思了。
这款蜂窝型扫雷确实让我眼前一新，画面不如经典扫雷般“classic"，引入的各种推理规则也确实不错，可以值得推敲一番。上手难度低，适合休闲时玩。
但缺点也是十分明显的，首先游戏没有随机性，意味着你背板也能通关，其次游戏关卡实着有点少，没有游戏随机性的情况下，这么少的关卡只能让人玩完就删游戏扔库里吃灰了。
不过想一想，就是因为各种推理规则的限制下，这款游戏才失去游戏随机性的吧，所以说这有点自相矛盾了。若想迎合游戏性，只能推理规则退让一步了[spoiler]，但这一改就是大改，考虑到游戏成本问题，或者说作者根本没考虑过这些东西，大概这就是为啥了吧（笑）[/spoiler]。
总的而言，这是一款有创意但深度不够的游戏，明显还有许多发挥空间的[spoiler]但还是那句游戏成本问题（笑）[/spoiler]。个人评分嘛，6/10吧。闲着无聊的大概可以买来玩玩，反正也不贵。

First impression of this game - Ah, it is going to be brain draining and I am probably gonna suck at playing XD 

Well, thankfully it didn't turn out this way! When I played the first few puzzles, it already impressed me! I am feeling very tired today, and surprising, I don't feel tortured (maybe YET). Completed 2nd World and still didn't feel drained! That is awesome! 

The puzzle reminded me of the mine bomb game in your PC back in the olden days. I never liked that game :S I am very satisfied with this one. You can check the guide first, IF you want the "Perfectionist" achievement. 

[u][b]FOR YOU[/b][/u]
- If you like light puzzles, this is good really light
- If you are old and want to sharpen your brain, this is a good game to consider
- Each level is easy to complete and doesn't have brought-forward effect. Great for in between work/study.
- I think it is good for kids to train simple logic and deduction skills. 

[u][b]NOT FOR YOU[/b][/u]
- If you are Mensa level player, ah, you can forget this. It's child's play for you.
- If you hate to use your brains at all.

35911844.review: A fantastic little puzzle game. I would describe this as a more sophisticated version of Minesweeper. You get clues to where the things you're looking for are by being told how many are nearby, and deducing the necessary configuration. Except the grid is hexagonal instead of square, the map isn't perfectly connected, and the clues can contain different information than just how many things are adjacent. But most importantly, the levels are designed instead of random, which means that you won't end up with a 50/50 guess like so often happens in Minesweeper. A very satisfying experience.

35853763.review: A different and refreshing, albeit short, take on Minesweeper. There are 30 levels that all require logic to solve, and there is always something on the board that guarantees you don't have to guess (unlike those annoying 50/50 guesses that minesweeper can come down to). It's very satisfying to sit down and power out the puzzles, with the only really nagging issue being that flagging an open spot vs. a mine (or blue hex in this game) is swapped from minesweeper, so you have to be conscious of which button you're pressing for most of the game. It's not a ton of content, but performs as a much better version of a basic game for just under a dollar on sale. Definitely a good game to fill out a holiday sale.

35755712.review:
Starts off feeling a lot like Minesweeper and ends up... feeling a lot like Minesweeper, but this is so much better. The beginning almost felt more challenging than the later levels, mostly because the game trains you to be mindful of taking care before making a decision. 

I challenged myself to not use my mistakes to allow me to cheat through the puzzles, and I think that was crucial to enjoying it. You could pretty easily just burn through it and get the achievements, if that's your thing, but you'd be missing out a very accessible and challenging reward. Very few games have this level of challenge while still giving plenty of information so that the puzzle doesn't feel unfair.

Looking forward to playing the sequels.

Hexcells is basically a version of Minesweeper that cuts out the random guessing inherent to the latter. Between that and the twinkly music, it makes for a pleasant way to relax with a morning coffee.

Do note that the levels are specifically designed rather than randomly generated. If you're looking at this, it's probably worth picking up the entire Logic Puzzle Pack. Each game has its own charms, and Hexcells Infinite brings an infinite puzzle generator to go with the pre-crafted ones.

35477936.review:
I don't understand the people saying "It's just like minesweeper if you like minesweeper you'll like this..."

The only way that this game is like minesweeper is that you reveal what is beneath hidden tiles. That is where the similarity ends.

If you make a mistake in the game, it is entirely your fault. There is no luck. Its all about pure logic. If you play this game without caring wether or not you make a mistake, then you are turning it into a different game altogether and not playing it as intended. Another user's ridiculous comment on his negative review "there is no penalty for making a mistake." The penalty is the mistake itself and it makes perfect sense for this game.

All that said, this game is fantastic. This is easily my favorite 2D puzzle game. The sequels only get better. Go buy this and its sequels.

34562275.review: Hexcells is a relaxing and esthetically pleasing reincarnation of Minesweeper, so anyone familiar with the latter should be able to easily pickup the former (and should have a good idea of what they are getting into). Puzzles are very easy and addicting, soundtrack is pleasant and not intrusive, and minimalist user interface looks nice and clean, but the game is not without faults. User interface does not do a good job of explaining what all the various icons mean. There is an achievement for finishing all levels without mistakes, but there is no indicator next to each level and you seem to always get a full score regardless (if the achievement actually checks mistakes, good luck trying to figure out which levels need to be replayed). The same problems plague the provided instructions, which are not clear and fail to explain key concepts (such as whitespace between cells). The puzzles are extremely easy and don't really get any harder throughout the course of the game. In fact, there is no sense of progression in general as all of the mechanics are introduced all at once in Part 3 (out of 6), so it just feels like you are solving the same puzzles over and over. It would have made much more sense to introduce one new mechanic in each chapter, and to make the puzzles randomly generated to add replayability and remove guessing and memorization as viable strategies. The soundtrack consists of a single track that gets repetitive after a while too. Luckily, the game is very short so it never gets boring, and is very enjoyable despite feeling unfinished. It's just a shame that the developer didn't take the time to polish this gem.

34551278.review:
Salut les gamers !

Des fois je m'ennuie... Souvent en fait ! Et j'ai pas envie de me lancer dans un casse tête, un jeux nerveux, ou un truc avec une intrigue... Je veux juste me reposer. Et je pense que celui qui a fait ce jeu avait la même ambition.

Hexcells est un petit jeu de puzzle développé par Matthew Brown. Un jeu qui mêle réflexion, stratégie, et détente... 

Le principe est ultra simple, mais va devenir de plus en plus compliqué au fil des niveaux. En effet vous devez cliquer droit ou gauche sur une case orange pour qu’elle devienne noire ou bleue, les noires ont un numéro qui indique le nombre d’hexagones bleus sur ses côtés, cela peut donc aller de 0 à 6. Et le but est qu’il n’y est plus d’hexagone orange… 
Ce jeu vaut autant qu’un sudoku ou un carré magique. Il fait réfléchir tout en nous gardant détendu, et cela n’est pas forcément aisé tant les énigmes peuvent faire rager dans les jeux vidéos. 
Ce jeu a un gameplay simple et n’essaye pas d’ajouter de nouvelles mécaniques après chaque niveau. Ici on n’essaye pas de perdre le joueur, on l’accompagne… Il y a quelques nouveauté après un chapitre mais une fois les 2 premiers terminés, le joueur a toutes les cartes en main pour terminer le jeu. En revanche le jeu s’avère très court, finis en à peine 2h, 3 si on veut le faire sans erreurs, on s'attendait tout de même à plus, surtout que le jeu est loin d’être dur...

Le style, quand à lui, est très épurés, peut être même simpliste, mais cela colle parfaitement à l’ambiance qu’essaye d’installer le jeu. 
Mais c’est surtout par la musique ou plutôt les sons que le joueur peut vraiment se sentir détendu. On a en continu une musique composé d’énormément de notes, faisant penser au vent ou à la mer... Et la petite touche d’originalité, lorsque qu’on découvre un hexagone, une note qui se mêle à la mélodie est jouée ! Cela nous positionne en tant qu'acteur, et en plus c'est assez ludique. En bref tout ces ingrédients vous mettent dans un état de plénitude totale. 

BILAN :

Les +
- Zen
- Principe simple et accrocheur
- Meilleur solution contre l’ennuie 
- La bande son détente

Les -
- Trop court
- Manque de difficulté même sur la fin
- Pas de bouton “retry”

Ce jeu n’est qu’un parmi tant d’autre puzzle qui n’ont pas d’autre ambition que de vous occuper, mais celui ci est très réussis, simple à comprendre, et qu’est ce qu’il détend ! Et si vous n’êtes pas satisfait vous pouvez toujours arrêter les jeux vidéos et aller vous coucher c’est aussi un excellent remède contre la fatigue…

34329038.review:
Excelente trilogía con idénticas bases y aspecto en cada juego. No es imprescindible haber jugado los interiores, en cada uno se dan las instrucciones necesarias. Soluciones muy elegantes en los 3 repasando todas las pistas cuando parece que ya no puedes avanzar (con la excepción de algunos niveles del "Plus", como comentaré).

El primero, Hexcells, tiene una [b]duración de menos de dos horas[/b]. Una única solución posible en cada nivel. Muy recomendable empezar por este y ver si es lo tuyo o no, porque siempre podrás devolverlo si no te convence.

La continuación Hexcells Plus introduce nuevas reglas, tiene unos cuantos niveles de bastante mayor dificultad, pero el problema de que algunos tienen múltiples soluciones y no hay pistas suficientes para saber cuál es la correcta, tienes que jugártela a suertes. En mi opinión el desarrollador colocó un producto mal terminado para aprovechar el tirón del anterior.

El último de la serie, Hexcells Infinite es el que debes comprar después de haber probado el primero. Mismo aspecto y mecánica, pero algo más demandante y con un generador de niveles para que no se te acabe y la opción de dejar un tablero parcialmente resuelto para continuar en otro momento.

34091967.review:
An awesome little puzzle game, that takes the premise of Minesweeper but adds some additional logic rules (including some Picross rules, though not to the degree of SquareCells) and takes out the randomness. All puzzles are 100% logic solvable, with no guessing required - so at the risk of sounding condescending, if you're reading a negative review by someone who says guessing is required, they just couldn't logic the puzzle out. I was able to logic solve them all, and when I did make an error, I was able to figure out what error in logic I had made, or what I had failed to notice, that caused my mistake. The game lets you make a few mistakes without failing you on the level, but as a perfectionist I restarted from scratch each time, and was able to clear them all. I found both the difficulty and the learning curve to be fair.

The only downsides I see are:
1. Since the puzzles are fixed, not a lot of replay value...BUT, for the cost, it's still a solid value for the time to do even one playthrough - especially if you get it on sale, like I did.
2. The mouse buttons are opposite to Minesweeper, so if you're used to it (and that is kind of the target market here), it's hard to readjust. I messed up more puzzles by confusing the mouse buttons than by making a logic error.
3. There's no "maybe" flag like there is in Minesweeper, so you have to do all your "what if" analysis in your head or on paper.

Fully recommend.

34079957.review:
A fantastic little puzzle game with a novel twist on the Minesweeper formula. Hexcells isn't big, but it is clever. As the game goes on, it adds several layers of complexity to what is initially a simple concept, and things get very challenging by the end.

The sound and music are also worthy of note, being minimalist but lovely. I never got tired of how the reveal sounds synced up to the music.

The only downside - and a small one at that - is that you can 'cheat' by flicking the mouse quickly over a hex and seeing a glimpse of the colour underneath. This is easy enough to do by accident, revealing a hex that you hadn't worked out yet and spoiling part of the puzzle.

33842721.review:
Hexcells is a terrific, relaxing puzzle game. It takes place on a hex-based grid, and the point of each level is to figure out which cells to mark and which to not, similar to the premise of Minesweeper, but in the best possible way. There are several different mechanics introduced throughout the game, and each is introduced well and used in interesting ways in the following levels. There are 30 total levels, and some are short, mainly for the purpose of introducing a concept, but some, particularly the later levels, can take quite a while. I don't remember how long it took me the first time, but I've played through a few times to get to my current playtime.

It is nice that there is a unique solution to each level, and guessing is never required. You can always progress purely through logic, it just may take a bit to see how. There's no time constraint involved at all, so there's no reason not to take your time and work carefully through the levels. I found that almost all the mistakes I made were when I went too fast and hit the wrong button. The soundtrack is ambient and very relaxing, and the game does a good job of making the sound effects for actions in the game go with the music too.

The achievements come from progressing through the game, and from perfecting every level. The game's definition of 'perfecting' a level is nice and generous, and you can make a single mistake and it still counts, which comes in handy in some of the larger levels where at least one mistake is fairly inevitable. The achievements aren't too hard to get, though you may need to retry a level of two to minimize your mistakes.

Overall this is a wonderful, relaxing, puzzle game, and while it is somewhat on the short side, if you like it you should definitely get the other two, Hexcells Plus, and Hexcells Infinite. They're all wonderful, and Infinite even comes with a level generator.

マインスイーパをベースとしピクロスを合わせたような、オリジナルのシステムんパズルゲームです。
ただしマインスイーパと決定的に違うのが、このゲームは「運の要素が全くない」というところでしょうか。

マインスイーパは一手目や行き詰ったところで、運を頼りにパネルを開けると言った場面がありますが、
このゲームはそのような不確実な要素は一切ありません。
一見、安全なパネルがない！と思えるステージでも、
よくよく数字を見て論理的に考えればどこを開ければいいのかが見えてきます。

33354262.review:
Hexcells is a short puzzler somewhat similar to the traditional minesweeper. Essencially, you have to follow the hints within the board to find out if each one of the hidden cells is blue or grey; as you turn up the cells, they might give you more hints to help you proceed.

The gameplay is fairly simple: you must use the mouse's right button if you think that the hidden cell is grey and left button if you think it is blue. At the end of each level, you earn blue cells as a reward: the less mistakes you make, more cells you earn. 

This is a relaxing game with a beautiful design and calm soundtrack; the difficulty increases progressively, but you will probably have to try some levels a few times before you complete them without making mistakes. The final levels might keep you busy for a while, but keep in mind that it is a game you can finish in less than two hours.

Es un buscaminas con esteroides. El concepto es el mismo pero la ejecución totalmente diferente. Aquí tienes una interfaz y estilo visual muy limpio (me recuerda mi adorado Mini Metro) con música y sonidos relajantes. Conforme avanzas escenarios, el reto se incrementa (como el 99.9% de los videojuegos) y hay nuevas mecánicas que le siguen dando vida al paso de las horas.

El único punto negativo que veo es que todos los niveles son fijos, es decir, no existe un acomodo aleatorio de patrones; esto implica que si fallas en un nivel, basta con ver dónde fallaste y la siguiente ocasión lo corriges, lo cual le quita muuuuuucha rejugabilidad.

Mi veredicto final es: MUY RECOMENDADO. 8.5/10.

「最後の最後に残った2マス1地雷で運試しを迫られるのは勘弁！」という方にもお薦めできます。

ヒントと言っても直接当たりハズレを教えるものではなく、理屈で解くために足りない情報を補う形ですね。
『 {3} ：青マス（≒地雷）が3つ連続している 』
『 -3- ：青マスは3つあり、全てが連続してはいない（2つ連続していることはある）』
など、ピクチャーロジックパズルに似ています。

以下、購入して「さぁプレイしよう」という方向けの補足。
マスの外に書かれた上記ヒントは左・右クリックで視覚的補助ができます。
マスが離れていても直線上に並んでいれば『連続している』扱いになるのでご注意を。
実績コンプに必要なポイントをどこで取り逃したのかは、選択画面のアイコンに光沢が有るか無いかで判ります。

33264585.review:
Minesweeper meets Sudoku 

A straight forward puzzle game. Simply reveal all the hexagons in a given level (turning them to black or blue). There are various clues that are provided to let the players know which cells are which. The game ramps up in difficulty with larger puzzles and more clues. 

I found the puzzles sufficiently challenging (particularly when trying to solve with no mistakes). The music is nice. There are only 30 maps with limited replay (the game can be completed in 2-3 hours) and there isn't much in the way of options (music is on or off, you can flip mouse keys, change the resolution). There wasn't a save feature but I found I was able to complete most puzzles in 15 minutes or less.

It's a good game for a few bucks that you can judge if you want to move on to the more challenging Hexcells + and infinite. While I do have a favorable opinion about this game, you wouldn't miss out on skipping it and going to Hexcells Plus.

33196128.review:
This is a very short, but very compelling little puzzle game. It's relaxing, and every puzzle has a clear logic behind it. It's good at teaching you the rules and then slowly escalating the difficulty of puzzles, but not to the point that they get frustrating.

I've played through this game a few times, and never really come up against any barriers which I need to use guesswork to get around.

It's well worth even the full price, and I also recommend the other games in the series: Hexcells Plus, which is harder, and in 25 hours of playing it, I've never actually completed it; and Hexcells Infinite, which I've put 60 hours into and never completed, mostly because it has a random puzzle generation that's good to dip into.

33018388.review:
"Hexcells" is a very well done, fun little game.  As everyone has said, it's like Minesweeper with hexes instead of squares.  The learning curve is perfectly done, and even I (who maybe played a handful of Minesweeper games several decades ago) completed it without problem.  I've got only a few quibbles:

- The game is short.  Its 30 puzzles took me 4.1 hours to complete, and I'm SLOW at this.  Still, I paid less than a dollar for it during the Steam Summer Sale, so it was worth it.  Heck, even by my el-cheapo "dollar an hour" metric for games, it's worth it at its current list price of about three dollars.  Still, It would be nice if it were longer.

- Even though the game is playable under Steam's Family Sharing capability, it doesn't handle its Achievements well in that.  Anyone who shares your game gets all the Achievements you got when you played it.

- The main menu in the game has 3 "slots."  Initially, I thought they were for different clumps of puzzles.  Instead, it turns out those are just a poor man's set of profiles.  The puzzles inside the slots are identical to each other.

- The white space between hexes in the puzzles isn't really explained well.  It turns out that when counting neighbors of hexes, the white space is important:  the stuff across it doesn't count.  But, when looking for contigous or non-contiguose hexes in rows or diagonals, the white space gets ignored.

All of the above are just minor nits.  So, I'm happy to recommend the game.

33008867.review: For the most part a very pleasant, calm puzzle game. I lost probably about 15 games that were close to being finished, simply because I clicked the wrong button, which caused me a great deal of annoyance. Overall I recommend the game, it's worth the money I spent on it, and if you have better finger coordination than me, you'll enjoy it even more.

32860447.review:
An excellent puzzle game, reminiscent of the old Minesweeper game on Windows, only much better.

[u]Pros[/u]:
+ Polished and relaxing interface. The game is nice to look at, and as you will stare intently at your screen to find the solution, this is not to be dismissed.
+ Ambient sounds are perfect.
+ Interesting and evolving gameplay.
+? Easy achievements.

[u]Cons[/u]:
- May lack challenge.
- Very short (I perfected the game in less than two hours so I could have got a refund).
- Little replay value. 
- Some rules are unclear (adjacency in discontinuous rows and columns especially).
- The rules are only explained in the level where they appear for the first time. A reminder of all rules would have been helpful. 

[u]Verdict[/u]: Highly recommended. Cheap and smooth, nice and relaxing, fun and a little challenging, this makes a perfect addition in your puzzle games library. Two sequels, increasingly more challenging, are available on Steam. 

[u]Comments and developments[/u]:

In this game you must find the 'bombs' hidden on some pattern made of adjacent hexagons. Just as in Minesweeper, hexagons tell you how many bombs are to be found in the neighboring cells. As the game goes on, new mechanics are added: how many bombs there are in row and columns, whether the bomb are adjacent are not. Only by combining all the clues can the bombs be all found. 

It must be stressed that the levels are not random. Hence, they have been carefully crafted and there is a logical way to go through. Unlike Minesweeper, you will never start by randomly clicking and if you are stuck, it's only because you missed a clue or did not figure out how to combine them adequately. All levels can be achieved with no mistake.

Also, a very good thing: the first mistake doesn't count and you can still get a perfect score. However, if you commit a second one, the first mistake will also be counted as such. As clicking errors happen, this little safeguard is a real blessing.

32810137.review:
[h1][b]Review: Hexcells[/b][/h1]
Hexcells ist ein äußerst angenehmer und kleiner Gelegenheits-Puzzler, mit 30 Levels, welcher optisch dem Muster einer Wabe ähnelt. Von der Spielmechanik kann Hexcells am besten mit dem klassischen Minesweeper verglichen werden - man deckt die Zellen auf, wobei diese entweder Blau eingefärbt sind oder eine Zahl dahinter verbergen, welche weitere Infos über die umliegenden Zellen gibt. Die Musik die im Hintergrund läuft ist äußerst entspannend und lullt Personen im näherem Umfeld völlig ein - persönliche Erfahrung gemacht *haha*.

Ein Menü für Einstellungen im Spiel gibt es nicht. Man wird direkt zur Levelauswahl geleitet. Mögliche Einstellungen können also nur vor dem Spielstart getätigt werden. Von der Dauer her ist das Spiel recht kurzweilig. Wie bereits zuvor erwähnt hat das Spiel eine gewisse ähnlichkeit mit Minesweeper, jedoch wird die Spielmechanik mit steigendem Level zunehmend komplexer. So gibt es Zahlen in geschwungenen Klammern, sowie zwischen zwei Minuszeichen, welche jeweils unterschiedliche Bedeutungen haben und sowohl innerhalb einer Zelle als auch außerhalb vorkommen können. 

Bei den Tutorials wusste ich zunächst aufgrund der minimalistischen Erklärung nicht ganz wie diese Werte zu interpretieren sind, weswegen ich entweder eine Übersetzung ins deutsche oder zumindest etwas ausführlichere Anleitung in Englisch als vorteilhafter empfunden hätte. Da das Spiel zur Gänze auf Logik aufbaut ist "raten" im Grunde keine Notwenidgkeit, sprich es ist möglich jedes Level ohne einen Fehler durchzuspielen.
[b][u]Zur Info:[/u][/b] Für das erreichen der vollständigen Punktezahl ist in einigen Level es durchaus erlaubt Fehler in einem geringen Ausmaß zu machen, also lieber mal durchspielen das Level und nicht gleich neu starten. ;-)

Bezüglich der Spieldauer möchte ich noch anmerken, dass sich Hexcells ein bisschen wie eine Demo angefühlt hat, wobei wenn man einen Euro pro Spielstunde als fairen Preis rechnet, kommt man hierbei selbst ohne Sale auf seine Kosten und dürfte nicht meckern. Persönlich empfehle ich jedoch lieber beim Ganzen Paket zuzuschlagen, da aus den Diskussionsbeiträgen hervorgeht, dass die Nachfolger wesentlich anspruchsvoller sind.

Wenn euch das Review gefallen hat, dann lasst es mich bitte mit einem Daumen nach oben wissen, danke! :-)

32735400.review:
A modern take on minesweeper, with some interesting new additions. Loved it!

[h1]Pro's[/h1]
[list]
[*]It works just like the minesweeper we played back in the day, but has a modern twist on it that offers more depth. 
[*]No guesswork - you can solve everything with logic. I got stuck a few times but it felt like a revalation solving the puzzles!
[*]The theme is modern and gentle, perfectly suited for a puzzle game like this. Music and sound helps setting a calm mood. 
[*]It's really cheap, but has decent length for its price. I paid less than €1 for it and had about 6 hours of fun with this game!
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]You can only turn sound on/off altogether, but I would've loved to turn the music a bit lower but keep the sound at normal volume
[*]Making mistakes can cost you points that you need to get the perfect highscores, which can be quite bothersome if you have nearly finished the map and mixed up left and right mouse button. I would've liked a hotkey such as R to restart the map quickly or something like that.
[/list]

Personally I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a cheap but great brain teasing game. I've already purchased [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/271900/Hexcells_Plus/]Hexcells Plus[/url] (extra puzzles) and [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/304410/Hexcells_Infinite/]Hexcells Infinite[/url] (even more puzzles, and a random puzzle generator!) as well and I look forward to playing those. If you're interested in all of them like me, you could save even more by getting them all in the [url=http://store.steampowered.com/bundle/3331/Logic_Puzzle_Pack/]Logic Bundle Pack[/url].

Was this review useful to you? [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/26849460/]Please also check out the Izzy Reviews Curator page[/url] for regular updates on reviews for other games!

32732391.review:

操作：初始操作，和扫雷操作左右键反着来的。但是，进入游戏会弹出一个窗口，左边的是配置，右边的 Input 就是操作修改。
玩法：在最上面的方块出现的数值，比如2，代表这一竖着的一共有2个雷。
如果是｛3｝，代表竖着的，连续的3个雷。
如果是 -2-，代表是竖着的不连续的2个雷，这个不连续指的至少有一个不是连着的，不是隔一个有一个这种。

Sur le principe du Démineur, en bien plus sophistiqué(1), Hexcells excelle à défier votre sens logique. Ça peut lasser, personnellement j’ai apprécié. C’est relativement court, bien qu’il m’a fallu huit à neuf heures pour remplir les trois emplacements de score à 100 %, mais ce n’est pas là le plus important. Si vous n’êtes pas concentré, vous y passerez des journées entières.
Même refaire les niveaux déjà accomplis est intéressant car les possibilités sont si nombreuses que vous ne vous souviendrez jamais de la façon dont vous avez mené la partie précédente.
C’est élégant, la musique est, certes, répétitive mais on peut la désactiver et passer un disque à la place.
Si vous aimez la logique et passer votre temps à « terminer » les jeux jusqu’au score parfait, n’hésitez pas !

(1) les chiffres découverts ne se contentent pas de vous donner le nombre de cases bleues (l’équivalent des mines), ils renseignent sur d’autres paramètres comme la connexion entre les cases en question, leur nombre par colonne ou diagonale, etc.

31016480.review:
I love this game. As a puzzle junkie who really gets into logic puzzles, this has been one of the best I've ever come across. It combines some elements of nonograms with minesweeper and given the twist of putting it all into a hexagonal grid to add an extra axis to contend with. Also, the soothing ambient music that accompanies the gameplay is a perfect match that I thoroughly enjoy every time I find myself playing.

Hexcells, Hexcells Plus and Hexcells Infinite should be considered a single game, and should be played through in that order. This entry to the series started it all and is essential to play through first in order to really learn the rules of this series properly before moving on to the more challenging puzzles that come with the other games. There is a natural progression of gradually increasing difficulty as you work through the puzzles. More rules get introduced over time as well. Each adding a new level of complexity and challenge to the puzzles that follow. But one of the greatest strengths of this game series is that you never have to guess, as the puzzles can always be solved with proper application of logic and deductive reasoning.

30869084.review:
Não vou comentar sobre a qualidade do puzzle, mas sobre a série.

Hexcells tem 3 versões que basicamente são um a versão melhorada do anterior. O primeiro tem o jogo de campo minado básico, o segundo (plus) adiciona algumas funcionalidades a mais, o terceiro (infinite) a mesma coisa em relação ao segundo.

Cada um deles tem um conjunto diferente de puzzles pré-construidos. O Infinite tem um gerador de novo jogo -> como o antigo campo minado. Os outros não.

Então, o que você vai estar pagando pelos dois primeiros é um conjunto de puzzles estáticos. Coisa que o último gera à vontade se vc quiser jogar mais.

É quase como se o desenvolvedor, ao invés de fazer dois DLCs, lançasse mais dois jogos independentes que inevitavelmente sairiam um pouquinho mais caro pra tirar um pouco mais de dinheiro do jogador. Mas acrescentam pouca coisa.

5 paus não é um preço justo se for considerar o que os outros tem. Melhor pegar o infinite ou o primeiro só na promoção.

Шикарная головоломка с основой на сапере, но сложнее и интереснее. Входных данных обычно больше, чем просто количество "мин" вокруг гексов. К примеру их количество в столбце или в диагонали, характеристика их расположения по признаку последовательности.

  Но что меня реально зацепило, так это возможность пройти игру полагаясь только на логику, анализ и моделирование положения мин, в отличие от того же сапера, где можно было упереться в ситуацию "победи с вероятностью 50%". 

  К сожалению есть пара незначительных минусов. Во-первых, из 30 уровней около 7 простых обучающих, считай, четверть игры. Во-вторых, жаль, что нет возможности отключить анимацию, на сложных уровнях она только отвлекает. Кроме того есть что-то вроде бага, когда курсор вызывает раздражающее зацикленное дрожание не открытого гекса.

  Но это все мелочи. Советую к покупке любителям головоломок, игра замечательная, заставляет пошевелить мозгами. Рекомендую сразу проходить игру на достижение "Перфекционист", так она раскроется наиболее полно. И обратите внимание на существование ещё двух игр в серии Hexcells, если первая часть пришлась по душе.

30579341.review:
HexCells is a delightfully entertaining little twist on MineSweeper.     Rather than trying to beat the clock,you just have to find the mines.  If you so choose, you can see if you can do it without setting any off.  If you manage a perfect score on every level, there's an achievement for it, but the game is geared up towards pleasant play, so you tend to get enough lives per level that if you do mis-click a few times, it's not the end of the world.

The twist is that it's like Minesweeper crossed with those Logic puzzle games you used to do as a kid, or maybe a bit like the logic you'd use with Sudoku... You have to work out which cell to click by looking at some numbers that tell you the configuration of the hidden mines.  

Those numbers can be
* A certain number of mines on a column or diagonal
* A certain number of mines adjacent to a hex cell

And these can be modified such that the clue tells you whether
* they are adjacent to each other.
* They are not adjacent to each other.


Once you look at the various numbers, it's relatively easy to figure out the logic, and before you know it, you're sticking down blue hexes (the flags in minesweeper), and right-clicking to unveil number tiles.

The total game takes about two hours to finish.  I'm a perfectionist, so I did another speed-run through the game to re-do all the levels I tripped up on.  Unfortunately the game doesn't seem to tell you which those were, so I just re-played the whole game, and managed to finish it again in about 45 minutes.

there are definitely some strategies you can use.  It takes a little thought, but once you work them out, you can just look at the tiles and KNOW that a certain two will have a mine, while the other two might not.  That's fine, you mark the knowns, and come back to the unknowns later.    Doing that first 'pass', means that the other evidence just flows right through, and the level's over in a blink.

Some of the levels are set up beautifully, and the way the various adjustments to the hex hints combine together means your mind is always working, and piecing little bits of puzzle together.  Very rarely are you completely stumped.  

The only weirdness is that one level just introduces hexes which hang out by themselves with nothing around them.  These are always mines, apparently.  I guess you have to use elimination to get to the end and see those two hanging out, and have two 'flags' left to plant, I suppose.  It was kinda odd.

One level which is a real doozie with numbers all over the place and most of the screen filled with hexes took me almost 30 minutes to clear on the first pass. On the second, once I'd figured out the routine, I cleared it in under 5.  

I REALLY enjoyed this game. The creator has nicely meshed Minesweeper and logic puzzles into a short but sweet little game.

Infelizemente os padrões visuais finais não formam "figuras" reconheciveis, mas o jogo é bastante prazeroso no seu decorrer e lida de forma inteligente com erro e repetição, estimulando partidas cuidadosas e focadas mas sem punir excessivamente erros ou travar o progresso do jogador.

30479926.review:
[h1] Czym jest Hexcells ? [/h1]
Jest to gra logiczna podobna do Sapera, ale jest ona o wiele bardziej rozbudowana. Z każdym levelem gra jest coraz trudniejsza i dodaje również nowe mechaniki, które urozmaicają grę i czynią ją ciekawszą, atrakcyjniejszą. 
[h1] Ile może trwać i czemu ?  [/h1]
Gra ta nie przepuszcza gracza do dalszych światów bez opanowania danej techniki, co pomaga grę przejść bez żadnych przeszkód. Gra posiada 6 osiągnięć z jednym trudnym do wykonania. Może się wydawać krótką grą, ale jeśli niektórzy mają z tym problemy zajmie im  5 - 6 godzin (oczywiście w 100%), ale dla ludzi nie  przejmujących się osiągnięciami zajmie 1 - 2 godzin. 
[h1] Plusy [/h1]
- Można rozgrzać swoją szare komórki ;),
- W tle gra miła i relaksująca muzyczka,
- Nie jest prosta, ponieważ trudność poziomów eskaluje (według mnie to plus :P),
- Jest tania i ma dalsze części.
[h1] Minusy [/h1]
Niestety ma dwa denerwujące błędy. 
- Autor gry podał niedokładne wskazówki i żle zaprojektował poziom. Skutkiem tego jest strzelanie co akurat w danym miejscu gracz musi zrobić (np. kliknąć, aby zatwierdzić, że w tej komórce nic nie ma czy odznaczyć komórkę z cyferką). Gracze mogą poczuć flustrację i zdenerwowanie, które na pewno zniechęca do dalszego grania. Według mnie takie rzeczy w grach logicznych nie powinny się zdarzyć, ponieważ jak sama brzmi [b] LOGICZNE, [/b] czyli coś wynika z czegoś i nie może być inaczej.
- Kolejnym niedopracowaniem jest brak możliwości zapisywania postępów w środku wykonywania poziomu, restartowania oraz ściszania i podgłaśniania muzyki, ale to można zrobić w samym menu przed rozpoczęciem gry.
[h1] Podsumowanie [/h1] 
Hexcells jest grą ogólnie przyjemną i łatwą, może zająć jeden do dwóch dłuższych wieczorów oraz trzeba ją kupić na przecenie, bo prawie 3€ to znacznie za dużo. Kupiłbym ją najwyżej za 1,5€, a preferowałbym za 1 euro. 
Ocena 7+/10

30340632.review:
Der Name von Hexcells beschreibt das Spiel eigentlich schon ganz gut. Hexcells ist eine Art Minesweeper-Variation nur mit hexagonalen, also sechseckigen, Spielfeldern. Es gibt auch keinen echten Niederlage-Zustand. Das Spielfeld ist zunächst meist komplett gelb, ihr versucht anhand der Informationen, die ihr habt die Felder in schwarze Felder und blaue Felder einzuteilen. Fehler werden gezählt. Die schwarzen Felder haben Zahlen in ihnen, die angeben, wie viele angrenzende Felder blaue Felder sind. 

Zum Zeitpunkt des Reviews gibt es drei Hexcells-Spiele: Hexcells, Hexcells Plus und Hexcells Infinite. Der erste Teil hat mich laut Steam etwa 2 Stunden gebraucht bis zur Vollendung, Plus etwa 4, Infinite etwa eine, allerdings habe ich die letzten beiden Spiele nicht abgeschlossen. Dieser Review beschreibt alle drei Spiele, weil die sich sehr ähnlich sind. Nicht alle Elemente der späteren Spiele sind in den früheren. So enthält Infinite einen Zufallsgenerator für Level, der euch quasi unendlich viele Level zur Verfügung stellt, die ihr lösen könnt. Die früheren beiden Spiele haben das nicht. Plus ist meiner Ansicht nach der schwierigste Teil der Serie. 

Das Prinzip von Hexcells ist recht einfach, aber es kommen noch weitere Elemente hinzu. So stehen Zahlen an den Spalten, bzw. an den Kanten von Sechsecken, die angeben, wie viele blaue Felder in der Reihe sind. Zahlen in geschweiften Klammern stehen dafür, dass die blauen Felder definitiv komplett verbunden sind, mit Minuszeichen an der Seite dafür, dass die Felder nicht alle verbunden sind (wenigstens ein Feld steht ab). Später kommen noch Zahlen in blauen Feldern hinzu, die angeben, wie viele blaue Felder in der Umgebung von zwei Feldern sind, und schwarze Felder mit Fragezeichen drin, d.h. ohne Angabe, wie viele blaue Felder in der Nachbarschaft liegen. 

Die Rätselspiele steuern sich gut, mit einer Taste (bei mir linke Maustaste) deklariert ihr das aktuell mit dem Cursor überfahrene Feld als schwarz, mit einer anderen (bei mir rechte Maustaste) als blau. Weiter könnt ihr noch die Hilfestellungszahlen an den Rändern und in blauen Feldern ausgrauen, um zu markieren, dass die für euch keine Bedeutung mehr haben, weil ihr die Reihe bspw. schon gelöst habt. Ziel des Spiels ist es die Rätsel fehlerfrei zu lösen um die Maximalzahl an blauen Dreiecken zu erhalten. Mit denen schaltet ihr neue Rätsel frei. Es gibt in den drei Spielen jeweils sechs Welten mit jeweils sechs Rätseln, Infinite bietet den Zufallsgenerator, dürfte damit der klare Gewinner sein, wenn es um Inhalt geht. 

Das Spiel wirkt von der Optik her sehr klar, sehr rein, sehr stilsicher. Auch die Hintergrundmusik passt perfekt zum Spiel. Sehr ruhige Töne, die den Spielfluss gut unterstreichen. Jedes Mal, wenn ihr ein Feld aufdeckt macht das Spiel einen Ton - das passt einfach zusammen.

Hexcells ist ein cooles kleines Spiel, was euch für ein paar Stunden unterhalten wird. Wer auf Rätsel steht, macht mit den Spielen der Serie nichts falsch. Meiner Ansicht nach ist der Erstling der einfachste, damit ein guter Startpunkt für Anfänger, wer sich nur eines der Spiele kaufen will, sollte zu Infinite greifen, weil dort durch den Zufallsgenerator noch etwas mehr Inhalt geboten wird.

30335858.review:
Первая игра серии Hexcells, наиболее простая и подходящая для начинающих игроков.

[u]Игровая механика и геймплей[/u]
Механика игры напоминает всем известного "Сапёра", только в шестиугольном варианте. В начальных уровнях игрок оперирует только количеством мин вокруг одной клетки, но по мере прохождения добавляются новые условия - количество мин в столбце или диагонали, расположение мин последовательно или, напротив, через ячейку. Каждый уровень грамотно составлен, исключая необходимость угадывания. В игре 30 уровней разной сложности, дополнительных уровней не предусмотрено. Небольшой минус - невозможно сохранить прогресс уровня при выходе в меню. Оценка - 8/10.

[u]Визуальное оформление[/u]
Наброская оранжево-голубая палитра ячеек на белом фоне. Взгляд не устаёт даже при длительной игре - 10/10.

[u]Звуковое оформление[/u]
Фоновой музыкой звучит эмбиент, приятный будучи негромким, но все же чуть утомляющий, если засидеться в игре надолго. Ячейки отзываются на нажатия мелодичными звуками. Оценка - 8/10.

[u]Достижения[/u]
Несколько этапных достижений, получаемых по мере прохождения и одно - за завершение каждого уровня без единой ошибки. Выбиваются без труда.

Общая оценка - 9/10, однознаяно рекомендую любителям головоломок.

说点干货小技巧吧（行列的同样适用）
1.二联，三个格子中间那个肯定是。（其他连请类比，很多关都是多连中间几个必是的）

六边形扫雷
对人品要求度极低，如果出现了需要蒙才能点的方块，说明你肯定漏掉的什么条件，重新看一遍全图吧
地图是固定的，并且预留3个存档，可以玩3次【并无卵用】

数字标记分以下3种：
x：表示有x个地雷
-x-：表示有x个地雷，并且这些地雷不是全连在一起的
{x}：表示有x个地雷，并且这些地雷全都连在一起
当数字标记在方块内时，表示周围的地雷满足数字标记；当数字标记在地图外时，表示这一列的地雷满足数字标记

左键标记雷右键点开方块，怎么说呢，操作不难，但总是点错，明明想标记地雷的就点了一下右键，mistake+1

30165643.review:
A very successful evolution of the classic "minesweeper"--Darwin would be proud.

There is very little need to "guess" as to spot selections, puzzles evolve/progress with new options/features at a very sound pace. There is significant variety in puzzles and this keeps the game enjoyable and fresh through the initial playthrough. However, Hexcells is NOT proceduarlly generated. As such, once you have played through the title you will need to shelve it for an extended period in order to have any viable replay value.

Although I own the other two installments in this franchise I have yet to play them. I hope that they, or a future 4th installment, will have some procedural generation options to afford a significant boost to replay value.

Overall, a fun, albeit very short, title which is well worth your money--especially if found on sale.

朋友10块钱送我的，非要叫我玩玩，花了几个小时全成就通关了
大致说一下，作为一款10块钱的小游戏，确实是物有所值。
首先说一下优点，关卡设计很巧妙，趣味性十足，动画效果和音乐也很棒，难度设计循序渐进对玩家挺友好。

其次白色的底色太tm费眼睛了，希望制作中在后续更新中（如果有）可以换个底色。
最后，说实话光卡有点少，挑战性不是很强，希望作者有后续更新


ps:这游戏如果说明清楚规则，是不存在让你猜一个的情况，是完全可以一个个推导出来的

30082944.review:
（精心设计的）关卡式六边形扫雷。
无随机关卡，无交易卡牌，一共6成就，没有中文。

一共六章。每章关卡4-6关不等。
左键确定该格为雷（确定为雷后格子表示为蓝色），右键确定该格为空白（确定为空白后会显示数字0-5）。
右上角上面为该关卡总雷数，下面为犯错次数。
菜单在左上角。 [strike]找了半天[/strike]
如果判断错误，无论是左键还是右键，都会在犯错栏里+1，全成就要求全关卡0错误（前面的少数关卡可以轻微犯错不影响成就）。
收集全的关卡会在关卡图标上有个透明的斜线（反光特效）。
因为在操作上反扫雷（win扫雷是右键雷左键空白），所以一二章算是新手关白送熟悉操作。
第三章开始，正片。

简单翻译一下设计的部分：
3：普通数字，同一般扫雷。
{3}：有3连。其他数字同理。
-3-：3不连。其他数字同理。
列外面的数字表示该列的雷数。左键点击列外面的数字可显示列的方向，右键取消显示。

规则很简单，但，
看到关卡的第一眼却是：WTF？这么复杂？你逗我？
通过关卡后的第一感觉却是：我的天，竟然过了？
非常的有意思。

全系列有三作，71%打包买的，稳赚不亏～全成就撒花～

30082007.review:
The [i]Hexcells[/i] series can be looked at as a modernized version of the classic [i]Minesweeper[/i]. The simplistic design allows the player to focus purely on the puzzle. The contrast between the hexes are clearly visible thanks to the usage of bright yellow and blue colors. The sound design in the game is as serene as it's sublime. Again, the focus of the player is directed to the gameplay and not on the ambient sounds, which do somewhat calm the mind. Of course, the goal of the game is to complete the puzzles with as less mistakes as possible.

Very close to coffee break puzzling perfection. You can spend anywhere from ten minutes to a lifetime playing and still feel like your brain is being tested. Highly recommended if you liked [i]Minesweeper[/i]. Basically, [i]Hexcells[/i] is what [i]Minesweeper[/i] should have been.

30074781.review:
지뢰찾기를 응용한 육각 형태의 퍼즐 게임.

누구나 한번쯤에 윈도우에 기본적으로 설치되어 있는 지뢰찾기라는 게임을 접해보았거나, 또는 들어본 적이 있으실 겁니다. 적어도 수십 개 이상의 버튼들 중에서 하나를 뒤집어 넓은 판을 만들어주거나 찾아낸 숫자로 주변에 있는 지뢰를 추리하거나 예측하여 지뢰가 있는 버튼을 제외한 나머지 버튼들을 모두 발견하여 게임에서 승리합니다.

이 Hexcells 이라는 게임 또한 근본적으로 지뢰찾기에서 사용하는 기본 패턴을 가지고 있습니다. 주변에 육각형으로 둘러 쌓여있는 공간 내에서 일반 블럭과 지뢰 블럭을 찾아내는 것이 목적입니다. 육각형의 블럭을 나타내는 Hexagon 과 세포의 의미를 나타내는 Cell 이 합쳐져 수많은 육각형의 세포로 이루어진 Hexcells 이라는 하나의 퍼즐이자 스테이지가 된다고도 볼 수 있겠군요.

플레이 방법은 위에서도 언급했듯이, 지뢰찾기 처럼 일반 블럭에 표시되어 있는 숫자로 주변의 지뢰를 파악하여 지뢰 블럭은 좌클릭으로, 일반 블럭은 우클릭으로 확인하여 퍼즐을 풀어나갈 수 있으며 좀 더 독특한 방법으로 힌트를 알려주는 {}, -- 기호들을 후반에는 응용하면서 퍼즐을 푸실 수 있게 됩니다. 거른 독특한 힌트들과 패턴들이 바로 이 Hexcells 이 가지고 있는 특성이라고도 말할 수 있습니다.

총 6개의 스테이지로 각각 나누어져 준비되어 있으며 플레이어를 위해 난이도는 차츰차츰 기본 과정에서 심화 과정으로 넘어가면서 가볍게 시작해보는 튜토리얼 스테이지부터 시작하여 기존에 소개했었던 패턴들의 도움말을 토대로 하여 이후에는 응용, 심화 스테이지들이 등장하여 눈으로 보기에는 복잡할 수 있겠지만 앞에서 배웠었던 패턴들을 토대로 하여 충분한 시간과 충분한 생각만 하신다면 블럭을 예상하여 풀지 않더라도 차근차근 풀어나가실 수 있도록 체계적으로 준비되어 있습니다.

저는 현재 Hexcells 을 클리어하고 난 후, 시리즈별로 함께 출시했었던 Hexcells Plus 와 Hexcells Infinite 에도 도전해보고 있습니다. Plus 는 기존에 배웠었던 패턴을 토대로 좀 더 심화적으로 준비된 스테이지들이 있으며 Infinite 는 마치 폭 좁게 제한되어 있는 듯한 레벨을 더 플레이하고 싶은 사용자를 위해 랜덤하게 짜여지는 퍼즐들과 함께 준비된 무수히 많은 스테이지들로 가득한 신비로운 시리즈이기도 합니다.

저는 개인적으로 머리를 써서 푸는 퍼즐 게임이나 전략적인 게임을 좋아하는 편입니다. 저처럼 퍼즐과 관련된 전략적인 게임에 관심이 있으시다면 강하게 추천해드리고 싶은 게임입니다.

Hexcells is a minesweeper with 0% luck and 100% guess, hexagons instead of squares and (far) better graphics. The rules are quickly and efficiently explained, leaving you to focus on solving the puzzles.

As the first of the Hexcells serie, it has (almost) all the refinements of the two latter games but severly lack in length due to a low level of difficulty. It took me less than three hours to finish the whole game and collect all the achievements, and at this point there was no reason for me to replay it.

Still, this game is worth playing but I would recommend to buy it as part of the Hexcells pack and/or on sales.

So I played and got all the achievements for the Hexcells series.
The order of which game should be played is Hexcells, Hexcells Plus and finally Hexcells Infinite.

FIRST OF ALL! This game and its ENTIRE series can be solved LOGICALLY! No guessing was NEVER required.
As people stated in other reviews, this game is a combination of minesweeper and picross (nonogram) which sounds about right.

The first of this series is quite simple and fun.
Numbers tell you a number of blue cell around it or on the line.
Left click to select a blue cell or right click to get a blank cell (for some reason, my brain took a while to understand what I wanted...)

Great game, recommended.
HOWEVER, if you expect the following games to follow the same format, it does not.
The new game is more challenging and longer. 
If you expect the same pace, it is not but heck it is more fun!

29363482.review:
[h1]Reasons why I'm recommending this game:[/h1]

1. Enjoyable puzzling - even though the core concept is very simple, enough mechanics are introduced to vary things up. 
2. Pure logic puzzles - you can guess, but you never have to. There is always a way to figure out the puzzle 100% without mistakes. This is also true of the following games (Hexcells Plus and Hexcells Infinity, though they increase the difficulty significantly). 
3. Very clean, functional and nice interface.

Overall I had a lot of fun with this game and its two sequels. While the core concept is similar to minesweeper, the added mechanics and the fact that you never have to guess to solve the puzzles makes it a far superior game to its inspiration. Recommended for anyone who likes pure logic games.

Hexcells is a logic puzzle that's similar to other number games like Minesweeper and Picross, as you use processes of elimination and deduction to fill in patterns of tiles. The distinction here is that since the tiles are hexagons, they're not restricted by square grids, and most puzzles look like abstract shapes or very loosely defined objects.  hexes have numbers on them from 0 to 6 indicating how many of the gold tiles around them can be clicked to turn blue, which counts toward stage completion.

-Not relax game xD
-Have fun.

29285929.review: The game provides a couple (2-3?) hours of entertainment. While I think it was worth the meager sum I paid for it, it sadly lacks replay value. The puzzles are not difficult or exhausting enough to leave you unclear as to how they were solved once you've completed them; you simply look at the numbers, do some counting, perhaps think 2 or 3 steps ahead and voila: puzzle solved. No additional clarity is gained from doing it over, and you will most likely be able to do the puzzles perfectly on your first attempt. The fact that all information is either given or easily excavated from what is given is both the strength and weakness of this game. It means you never have to guess, and that you don't have to bring prior knowledge apart from basic counting know-how. That's the way I like my puzzles. Sadly, it also means that if you get what's going on, the game becomes an exercise in doing something pretty rote. I found it relaxing.

29228978.review:
Hexcells erinnert anfangs an Minesweeper, wird jedoch schnell abwechslungsreicher. Ziel des Spiels ist es alle Felder aufzudecken. Diese können entweder Blau sein oder Grau sein und dann Informationen über die Anzahl benachbarter blauer Felder enthalten. Durch diese Information werden dann benachbarte Felder systematisch nach dem Ausschlussprinzip aufgedeckt. Zusätzlich wird durch Zahlen außerhalb der Felder angezeigt, wie viele blaue Felder sich in einer Linie befinden. 

Falls man mehr als einen Fehler in einem Level macht, bekommt man Punkte abgezogen. Am Ende des Levels erhält man dann eine für das Level festgesetzte Anzahl Punkte. Wenn man nicht alle Punkte freischaltet muss man das Level noch einmal machen und mit nur einem Fehler bestehen. Mit einer gewissen Anzahl Punkten kann man dann immer 6 neue Level freischalten bis insgesamt alle 30 Level freigeschaltet sind.

Da Hexcells ein abwechslungsreiches und auch auf gewisse Weise schönes Rätselspiel ist, dass sich mit etwas Ruhe und Geduld gut bewältigen lässt, kann ich es sehr empfehlen. Der Preis ist recht günstig und die Errungenschaften sind in diesem, ersten Teil der Serie, leicht zu erreichen.

Ich empfehle, dass Hexcells Complete Pack zu kaufen, da bei Hexcells Infinite ein Levelgenerator integriert ist, der bis zu 1 Millionen verschiedene Level generieren kann und somit die Mischung aus einfachen, schweren, symmetrischen, chaotischen und in Mustern angeordneten Leveln durch eine riesige Anzahl zufälliger Level abgerundet und dadurch die Wiederspielbarkeit massiv erhöht wird. Der Preisvorteil des Complete-Packs gegenüber dem Einzelkauf der Spiele ist ein weiterer Grund für das Pack. Besonders im SALE ist das Complete Pack durch seinen geringen Preis ein tolles Geschenk für Fans von Logik-Puzzles.

29136326.review:
Hexcells is a polished modern variation on the old Microsoft Minesweeper game. Although it is much gentler, rather than game-ending bombs the player is identifying certain hexes. If a mistake is made then it is just recorded and the game continues. There is no timer or time limit, nor any way of scoring other than the number of mistakes made. The puzzles are hand-designed (no randomness) and provide a couple of hours of thought to perfect with mix of basic logic and memory (as the puzzles do not change if restarted). It is a nicely polished game with clean graphical style and nicely responsive music. It has no replayability, but it is cheap and well made. Definitely worth picking up in a sale or bundle, as I will be doing with its sequels.

https://youtu.be/RfK164YvJh8

29122737.review:
[h1]Hexcells[/h1]

[b]Opět další hra, kterou je těžké doporučit a zároveň nedoporučovat.

Pokud si někteří pamatují ještě na hru Miny, nebo Hledání min, tak tato hra Hexcells je ji trošku podobná. Úkolem ve hře je pouze klikat pravou a levou myší na žluté šestihranné symboly, přičemž levou myší umístíš modré pole a pravou myší umístíš šedé pole. Při umístění šedého pole se ti ukáže číslice, když se ti ukáže  nula, budou kolem tohoto šedého šestihranného políčka modré pole (levá myš), takže klikat levou myší. Když se ti v šedém políčku ukáže 3, budou kolem políčka tři modré a tři šedé políčka.

Hra nabízí menší pomoc, a to takovou, že když se ti ukáže v šedém poli {4} budou modrá políčka kolem šedého políčka s číslicí v "řadě" za sebou (levá myš), a zbylá dvě šedé (pravá myš), když se ukáže -4- už je to nepatrně horší, někdy to docela pomůže ve hře, takže při -4- nebudou modrá políčka v řadě ale budou mezi ně vloženy šedé symboly, takže budou 4 modré a 2 šedé políčka.

Hra odpouští pouze jedinou chybu, proto když uděláš 2+ chyb, zapamatuj si polohu šedých a modrých symbolů, aby jsi při opakování neudělal stejnou chybu. Jinak tě hra nepustí do dalšího levelu.

[u]Verdikt:[/u]

Tuto hru budeš obdivovat a zároveň proklínat, hlavně kvůli dosti častým překlikům, což u mě bylo jich docela dost.
Hru doporučuji, hlavně kvůli jednoduchosti a zároveň náročnosti na myšlení. já jsem ji spíše proklínal, nechtěj slyšet ty peprná slova na hru. :-D

+ procvičíš si paměť, někteří se i naučí počítat do pěti :-D
+ odechovka
- ach ty ukliknutí 

[u]Hodnocení hry[/u]

90%[/b]

29005271.review:
整个系列包括三部作品。Hexcells，Hecells Plus，Hexcells Infinite。因为系统基本一样，所以放到一起来讲。
游戏时间：（全成就通关）
Hexcells 2小时
Hexcells Plus 9小时
Hexcells Infinite 主线通关大概13小时，60关随机无尽大概5小时

缺点：
界面过分简洁。想把音乐关掉还要回主菜单。前两代没有关卡进度储存，也没有暂停菜单。三代才有了一个聊胜于无的暂停菜单和自动进度储存。
按键跟扫雷相反。改键的话，一二代要在进游戏之前修改，三代要在主菜单修改。不是很方便，不过只用改一次，也可以接受。
完全没有自动完成的概念。举个极端的例子，所有雷已经被标出的情况下，那些不是雷的方块也需要一个个点开，有点麻烦。
对于追求完美通关的人来说，失误惩罚略严重。大图快完成的时候点错一次简直想死，建议掏出手机拍照重新点一次。状态不好经常点错的话（推理数错，点的时候脑抽搞不清楚左右键等等）建议睡一觉第二天再玩，不要硬来。
总的来说都是一些细节上的小缺陷，不算什么。
优点：
最重要的一条，每一关都一定有可以只通过推理得到的唯一解（而且这个推理不会复杂到整个图试填的级别，基本可以只靠眼睛看）。这是这个游戏的正确打开方式。有为数不多的几个英文差评说这个游戏需要猜，我只能说请给智商充值。另外，这个有唯一解的特性有时可以帮你跳过一些推理步骤（例如ABC一横排三个点，关于BC唯一的信息是BC之中有且只有一个雷，那么A一定不是雷，因为这样你才可能解出BC是什么），但其实不是必要的，建议不要用。
没用了的信息除了不是雷的点上的数字（黑数字）之外都是可以隐去的。当然如果可以把黑数字也隐去就更优雅了，不过现在这样已经很方便。
辅助线和辅助区域的设计非常贴心。在有了进度保存的第三作，如果你觉得辅助线不小心开了太多不想一个个关，或者是在某一关卡住了之后怀疑自己隐去了不该隐的数字，可以退出关卡重进，所有辅助线和隐去的数字都会恢复（当然点开的雷和数字不会，不然就不叫进度保存了）。

上面都是系统，下面说关卡。只有优点。
关卡设计都非常精巧，不是随便挑一些比较难的infinite的关然后就当作主线了。（后面的关）信息量被压缩到了最小，如果观察不同人同一关的流程，基本上会是一样的。不过这种唯一性因为条件设计得足够隐蔽，并不会无聊。
足够难。这个游戏的玩法本身可以做成扫雷那样的运气推理结合的游戏也可以做成数独那样纯粹的推理游戏，它选择了后者。有的推理很难，可能要看几分钟甚至更多才能看出来，但是也正是这种推理在完成之后给人最大的满足感。这是一个纯粹推理的游戏应该做到的。
节奏感非常好。数独这类的填空推理，都会有一种滚雪球效应。一开始填最难，后面空格少了之后就水到渠成了。Hexcell通过引入？方块，可以将你的成果截住。经常出现的情况是苦思几分钟，势如破竹扫雷一般搞定半片地图，又卡住，再苦思几分钟然后扫雷。这种张弛之间的节奏感是很难得的。

一个纯粹的解谜游戏，循序渐进、难而有趣的关卡，张弛有度的推理快感，优雅的设计（唯一解、隐去数字、画面简洁）。
全包原价34人民币总共108关加上infinite无限生成说实话已经很便宜了，打折之后全包只需10块简直不买是人。
抽象解谜类作品的必玩典范，非常推荐。

28896900.review:
TL;DR Short, play-at-your-own-pace-and-moral-of-not-cheating puzzle

It's a nice, simple puzzle game. It's pretty short, 31 levels, with 100% achievement completion requiring you to complete each level with 1 mistake or less. These levels will stump you and leave you wondering, "HOW IN THE WORLD AM I GOING TO SOLVE THIS?" or, "HOW IN THE WORLD WAS I SUPPOSED TO LOGIC THAT?" There isn't any penalty for guessing, except that eventually you'll run out of this game's equivelant of stars to move to the next world or trying to completely finish this. Fast thinkers might be able to speed run this and refund it with 100% achievement completion. So the question you ask yourself shouldn't be, "Is this game worth taking up my short, useless time on this planet?" It should be, "Can I finish this fast enough to refund this?"

9/10 The sound effects were quite annoying on some worlds

28875284.review:
I played through this whole thing in one sitting today (around 3 hours).  I always thought Minesweeper was a better game than it was given credit for, and Hexcells improves on Minesweeper in pretty much every way.  There is no guessing in Hexcells, everything is completely 100% solvable.  There are also some interesting new mechanics at play, like seeing the "mine" count for certain rows or columns, or getting information beyond just a number, like whether all the adjacent mines are touching each other or not.  I was VERY pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed this, and I'm looking forward to trying out the other Hexcells games soon.

Side note-- the function of the left and right click are swapped from how they are in Minesweeper.  If you have played a decent amount of Minesweeper, do yourself a huge favor and swap the Hexcells controls before you start playing.  I didn't, and it screwed with me more than I'd care to admit.

28571894.review:
Долго думал покупать или нет, так как люблю вечерами поиграть в головоломки, но в отзывах ссылались на отсутствие логики в последних уровнях, что, грубо говоря, тихий ужас для такой игры. Но любовь к саперу все таки взяла свое, и я купил эту игрушку. 

Первое впечатление - хаос и потерянность от того, что по "минам" надо кликать левой кнопкой мыши. Долго не мог привыкнуть из-за старого доброго сапера, но вскоре освоился и втянулся. [u][b] Итак, господа, знайте - врут все эти люди, которые не могут найти логику в последних уровнях.[/b][/u] Специально проходил всё, исключительно обосновывая каждый свой ход логически. Все спокойно проходится, а те люди с отрицательными отзывами просто поленились подумать и предпочли пройти игру методом тыка. Пожалуй данный метод прохождения и есть единственный минус этой игры, ибо не каждый волей силен и может быть сломлен довольно скоро.

Рекомендую игру каждому любителю головоломок, а особенно ярым саперистам.

28415578.review: This is a very good puzzle game.  It's certainly short, but the rules are very straightforward and make it so that at no time is it necessary to take a wild guess on where to go next.  There is always some way to figure it out logically, even if you have to look at it from a different angle or use your mind in a way that the game didn't bother to spell out for you.  I appreciate that all of the mechanics you need to understand are demonstrated in a simple tutorial level.  I really love how simplistic the design is as it streamlines what in other games could be bogged down and drawn out tutorials.  The different mechanics and rules that come up in the game adds more depth and possibilities for the puzzles, and does become more difficult towards the end of the game.  This is how Minesweeper should play, without the aspect of luck being necessary.  I'm looking forward to playing the next installment of this game.

通关啦写个测评~（目前进度只通关了第一部）
其实一开始看见三个slot以为是游戏的三大部分，直到通关点开第二个slot发现是一样的内容的时候才想起这应该是三个存档槽（参考Sparkle系列）…所以其实游戏流程并没有想象的那么长。
游戏操作和扫雷的原理相同。然而操作手法是相反的。一作本身难度并不高，我犯得绝大多数错误都是点着点着就不自觉的按照扫雷的方法去点，然后会增加一个错误数（所以玩的时候一直都是提心吊胆的…）。不过达成满星是允许每关有一个错误。所以至少第一部对强迫症（比如我）来说并不是那么不友好。全通关用了差不多三个小时，有几关比较复杂出现了返工的情况（非常少），中间我还去洗了个澡…所以其实慢慢来绝大多数关卡一遍过是没问题的。
Hexcells比扫雷更让我喜欢的一点就是游戏中是有逻辑可循的。如果不知道怎么办就先检查一下自己是不是还有可以敲开的黄块，或者看看是不是有算错了的情况（我剩下的所有错误基本上都是因为计算错误）。这种情况下就算是返工其实也不觉得枯燥，换一种思路往往会发现上一次的错误所在，甚至找到一种新的解决方法。（更何况扫雷二选一我从来都没选对过好嘛…）
游戏画面没什么好说的，这一类游戏画风一般都很简洁。每次点击黄块的音效我非常喜欢（叮叮咚咚好有爱~）。背景音乐一开始听起来很舒服，有人可能会觉得一直没有变化比较枯燥，我倒是觉得背景音乐一直在变的话反而会分散注意力。这种单一的环境反而可以算是体现游戏特点的一部分。
所以对于我来讲这是一款流程画风音乐和价格都刚刚好的游戏（买包入很划算）。除了操作别扭一点（不过讲道理好久没有这么集中注意力的玩游戏了。），我给9/10~剩下一分留给它进步~

27476755.review:
Hexcells is essentially an overall enhancement of Minesweeper. Where Minesweeper has mines, you have blue hexagons. Where Minesweeper has randomly generated puzzles that sometimes force you to guess, Hexcells has predesigned puzzles that always give you enough information to solve it without ever needing to guess. (Although sometimes it may feel otherwise.)

Why go for Hexcells over Minesweeper when there's a limited set of puzzles? Hexcells' puzzles are [i]incredibly[/i] well designed, starting simple and adding new mechanics as you move along. Beyond just telling you how many hexes nearby are blue, you get information on if they're all connected or not. Vertical or diagonal columns get similar treatment. Sometimes blue hexes have numbers in them, telling you how many blue hexes are in the surrounding area.

Eventually, you have to combine these hints in creative ways to determine where the blue hexes are—or where they aren't. When you're finally able to combine them all to work your way to completion, it provides a level of satisfaction that Minesweeper just can't compete with.

The only real downside to Hexcells is that it's pretty short—an acceptable downside, considering the price. Thankfully, Hexcells Plus (more puzzles) and Hexcells Infinite (more puzzles, a random puzzle generator, [i]and[/i] player-created levels) are available, and getting the complete pack is incredibly affordable (and highly recommended), especially on sale.

26939120.review:
前言：

此评测基于三作完全通关并达成全成就，而非Hexcells一款游戏。我同时也列出本人的三作游戏时间作为参考。

一作（Hexcells）：3.5h

二作（Hexcells Plus）：10h左右

三作（Hexcells Infinite）：16.6h（完成67个随机关卡）



综述：

先看游戏名，《Hexcells》中文译名《六角细胞》是非常贴切和准确的。“hex”取自“hexagon”（六边形）一词，“cells”多译为细胞。于是六角细胞这个生动形象的译名就出世了。

由于三作全部基于Unity3D引擎，因此进入游戏前选择①分辨率；②是否窗口化；③并没有什么用的选择画面质量（反正都是Fantastic）④更改控制键设置（Input）（重要！）

再看游戏主界面，此三作的主界面类似：有三个存档位供多玩家有不同的游戏进度。第三作的左下角比起前两作有更多细节上的优化，例如：可单独禁播音乐（前两作点击图标后是完全静音），游戏内设置鼠标按键扫雷和排雷的按键，多了一个随机关卡的按钮（毕竟三作为无尽版）。

最后进入游戏中，有人评价此系列游戏为数独+扫雷的结合体，因此本系列摒弃了扫雷中拼运气猜雷的设定而更具有逻辑性。又因此系列都基于该特点，故而三作本质上没有区别：通过游戏中的各种由简单到复杂的提示来扫雷、排雷。

游戏操作初始设置（重要！）是左键标雷，右键标非雷。这与习惯于扫雷这款游戏的人操作相反，不过不要紧，可以通过更改设置的方式来换回习惯的操作（更改操作详见加粗加下划线的位置）。



优点：

1.灵动的背景音——配合不同关卡中扫雷提示音使游戏变得更加清新

2.简单的操作——给得长期使用键盘的人们一次解放单手的体验

3.简约的画面——在如今华丽的游戏大环境下带来了一丝清风

4.循序渐进但又多样的操作及提示——使游戏更丰富，使玩家陷入其中无法自拔

5.三作限定——增加Restart选项和关闭后保存关卡选项，更贴合玩家需求



缺点：

1.进入游戏后（扫雷界面）无法选择关闭或开启音效

2.不够清楚的对比色——“大六边形”（边长为3格的六边形）（注1）所使用的半透明遮盖效果所覆盖的橙黄色区域与未被覆盖的正常橙黄色区域颜色对比不明显而有可能导致误点击。

3.提示不够明显清楚——添加辅助线的设定第一次出现在一作5-5中，一方面字小，另一方面该功能在之前的关卡就用得上。

4.对于强迫症党不友好——一二作如果为了全成就并不浪费太多时间，只能截图然后按照图上的再点一遍，大大增长了游戏时间。三作有特殊方法可节省时间，具体操作在小提示2中。

5.不知是否广普存在的小bug——未翻开的格子也可在某种触发条件下显示“大六边形”提示。具体截图暂无。

小提示：

1.[spoiler] 除了一作，二作和三作的最后一关都算是小彩蛋关卡，及需要通过文本难度很低也易懂的文字提示来完成该关卡。[/spoiler]

2.[spoiler]三作限定——由于关卡会在退出时自动保存，有强迫症但又不愿意再次点击已经玩过的部分的玩家可以用以下方法。首先将自己确定的部分点击出来，然后点击左上角的MENU→EXIT退回到主界面，再点击进入该关卡，一旦有错，直接右上角关闭游戏并再次进入游戏继续完成此关卡即可。[/spoiler]

购买建议：此系列是一款定位为休闲解谜类的小游戏。并且一作比一作更好，现如今ios端三作已全部上线（安卓端未知）。定价方面，PC端国区合集定价34元（优惠时10元），ios端合集定价40元，等暑促时此系列应该也会有降价。对于解谜+休闲有兴趣的玩家可以关注一下此系列，偶尔闲来无事打开游戏解解闷也不妨是一种选择。

对于挂卡喜加一党的建议：[spoiler]此系列无卡可挂[strike] （心塞）[/strike][/spoiler]

26911360.review:
Dear Developer,
first off f*** you for designing this really elegant iteration of Minesweeper. I had ideas for years on how to improve Minesweeper to make it less punishing and more fun for casual players. You managed to improve on every aspect of this really frustrating classic. You stole my ideas ;(

Everbody who has any fleeting interest in Minesweeper like games, should play this. It's perfect for what it is: 

Elegant, easy to get into, but not that hard to master and the best aspect is there is no randomness. If you mess up, it's totally your own fault. There are no frustrating 50/50 situations in corners like in Minesweeper, where you lose all motivation if you f***** up. You get a small penalty for messing up but it isn't ruining your day like in Minesweeper.

Puzzle Design is also top notch. Especially the difficulty progression is perfect. All gameplay elements are easy to understand and are well implemented into the puzzle design. There are no unfair difficulty spikes. Again, ELEGANT as f***.
Heck, my father understood this game from the get-go.

The User Interface is also for a lack of a better word, ELEGANT. Every element is perfectly simple and easy to understand.

The Music is also perfect for this. It's relaxing and helps you to concentrate to solve the puzzles. Nothing fancy but perfectly fitting.

I almost forgot the best aspect:
IT'S CHEAP. Even without discounts it's only 2,99. I played it for about 6 hours and it's totally worth it.

TL;DR
Hexcells should be the superlative of elegant. It's the best puzzle game ever. Buy and play it. Buy it again for your parents and friends.

Best regards
D3adalus

P.S.
I forgive you for stealing my ideas. Hexcells is way better than my imaginary game anyways :D

26760866.review:
I generally don't like puzzle games. They are far too slow for my liking, but I completely understand the appeal and wish I could like them more. Hexcells may have changed this for me, for it is a perfectly crafted game from the presentation to the mechanics.

You learn the rules as you go, but in a nutshell, you're tasked with finding all the blue hexes with a few clues. It plays very similar to minesweeper, but there is an emphasis on more complex rules to follow involving whether hexes are attached in a string and how many hexes are in a column.

"an ambient logic puzzle game" is the perfect descriptor for Hexcells, blending dynamic sound design with truly challenging and engaging problem solving. The sound interactions are employed in a way that only heightens the enjoyablilty of the game. The music and how your actions affect the sound is timely and bold, yet also soothing and ignorable.

My only real gripe with the game would be how certain mechanics are explained in a weird order, with one mechanic not actually being explained. However, it is easy to understand regardless, and overall the game is well worth a purchase.

26615749.review:
Hexcells is lovely! It's quite similar to both Picross and Minesweeper, in that it gives you a little bit of information to start with, which you then use to fill in or rule out cells in a hexagonal grid via the process of elimination. Compared to either of those games, however, Hexcells is a lot more relaxed. This partly because of its calm music and colour pallete, but also because the game doesn't feature a timer and doesn't punish you all that much for making a wrong move (it's mostly up to your discipline to stop yourself from guessing).

Small note: there are three hexcells games on steam, each are basically level packs. All three have good difficulty curves,  but both Hexcells Infinite and Hexcells Plus start a bit harder and get tough quicker. If you're getting just one this is probably best.

Si je devais résumer Hexcells : Démineur avec des hexagones. 

D'une idée basique : soit la case est bleue (clic gauche), soit elle est un nombre (clic droit), les développeurs sont parvenus à varier les plaisirs avec des mécaniques toutes simples qu'il conviendra de découvrir en y jouant.
Le jeu explique bien mieux que je ne le ferais, ses différentes mécaniques.

Le jeu est très épuré et permet de bien se concentrer sur ce que l'on fait. J'ai coupé la musique parce qu'elle est légérement énervante (en bas à droite sur l'écran du choix de niveau).

Le jeu est très court : 3H si l'on est dans la moyenne pour parcourir les 6 niveaux du jeu. Je n'ai pas eu de difficulté particulière sauf sur l'avant dernier niveau qui m'a demandé pas mal de concentration afin d'éviter la fausse manip pour faire le 100% (Principal intérêt du jeu).

Je recommande chaudement entre deux gros jeux et je conseillerais même de prendre le pack complet parce qu'Hexcells ressemble à un petit encas.
